xwikidoc.title: How to Find All Pages within a Space
xwikidoc.content:
1 Overview You can find all the *non user* Spaces in Curriki by selecting this link [Curriki Space>Admin.Spaces]. But once you find a space you are interested, how do you find all the pages related to that link?
Ludovic provided this simple search string. http://next.dev.curriki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SpaceIndex?space=Main or better yet, click the following link, which is not tied to next.dev.curriki and is relative to the server you are working on, for example, Production. [Search Space>Main.SpaceIndex?space=CRS]
Once you click the link you will notice the URL ends with '?space=Main', simply replace '?space=Main' with the space you want to search, for example, '?space=Groups' or ?space=CRS'. *VERY IMPORTANT: The space name you enter is case sensitive.*
1.1.1.1 Here is what I typically do:
1. I view the list of all spaces. [Curriki Space>Admin.Spaces]
2. Once I find the space I am looking for, I highlight and copy the space name
3. Then I run any search, like this one [Search Space CRS>Main.SpaceIndex?space=CRS]
4. Then I simply paste the name I cut above and press Enter
1 Popular Searches
[Search Space Main>Main.SpaceIndex?space=Main]
[Search Space Groups>Main.SpaceIndex?space=Groups]
[Search Space Registration>Main.SpaceIndex?space=Registration]
[Search Space MyCurriki>Main.SpaceIndex?space=MyCurriki]
[Search Space CRS>Main.SpaceIndex?space=CRS]
1 How to Search a Members Collection
Members collections are a cobination of Coll_ plus the members login name, such as ShermanTank.
Follow the same procedure outlined above but replace the '?space=something' with '?space=Coll_ShermanTank'.
